Title: Printing of Election and Electoral Registration Materials
Description:
Printing services are required to meet the needs of the Council in respect of (1) its delivery of all elections, (2) the Annual Electoral Registration Canvass and ongoing electoral registration work.  The Council intends to establish an agreement for 3 years for the election and electoral registration printing materials as follows-
• Ballot papers and Corresponding Numbers Lists (CNLs)
• Postal vote ballot packs
• Poll cards
• Large print ballot papers
• Grass skirts
• Canvass Household Enquiry Forms (HEFs)
• Invitations to Register (ITRs)
• Household Notification Letters (HNLs)
• Annual Postal Vote Personal Identifier (PI) Refresh letters
This shall include but is not limited to providing a full print and design service delivering poll cards, ballot papers, postal vote packs and relevant electoral registration forms.
Scheduled elections for the next three years: -
• May 2019 - Dorset Council and all 163 parish and town councils within the Dorset area
• May 2020 - Police and Crime Commissioner election
The Contract will cover the elections listed above, and any unscheduled by-elections, referenda or poll that may arise. Contractors submitting a tender will be expected to demonstrate a successful track record in supplying electoral printing. They must fulfil all legislative requirements and must be able to meet the required deadlines and any performance standards set by the Electoral Commission.

Title: Provision of Electoral Printing Services for Stafford Borough Council and Cannock Chase District Council
Description:
This is an electronic tender and all documents can be accessed only via the portal: https://supplierlive.proactisp2p.com/Account/Login

Further details are available in the attached Supplier Guide

Provision of printing and mailing services for canvasses and elections.  This will include production of:
•	Household Enquiry Forms (HEFs)
•	Invitation to Register Forms (ITRs)
•	Associated Reminder Forms for HEFs and ITRs
•	Polling Cards
•	Postal Voting Packs
•	Ballot Papers
 
Stafford Borough Council and Cannock Chase District Council require a rapid and cost-effective provision of services to meet strict electoral services deadlines, including electoral registration and elections.  The successful provider must have the ability to interface with IDOX and Xpress electoral management software systems and be able to offer a service that will facilitate seamless secure transfer of appropriate data.  Note that where there is any reference to a specific branded name of a product, service, accreditation etc the Council welcomes suppliers to offer a fully equivalent substitute.

Title: Specialist Printing for Electoral Services
Description:
Bracknell Forest Council is seeking to appoint a single Framework Supplier to deliver specialist printing services for Electoral Services. The Supplier shall provide fit for purpose electoral registration and elections printing service solution to realise our objective of centralising printing activity, where this is cost effective, and to make operational efficiencies within the electoral services team where possible.
 ** 14-Oct-16 Questions and Answers added to South East Business Portal**
** 21-Oct-16 Updated Questions and Answers added to South East Business Portal**
Additional Text:
The Framework duration will be for a maximum of 4 years, covering an initial period of 2 years plus 2 optional extensions, each of 1 year (i.e. 2 + 1 + 1) starting from March 2017.  Estimated Framework value over the four years ranges from £300,000 to £500,000.

Organisations must register their interest on the South East Business Portal in order to receive any changes or notifications issued by the Council during this tender process. The Council will not be held responsible for lack of communication to any organisation who does not register their interest.

Title: Electoral Printing Services
Description:
Wokingham Borough Council are inviting tenders for the provision of Electoral Printing Services, covering all elections and referenda during the contract period and printing for registration purposes.
The tender is divided into three (3) lots:
	Lot 1: Election Printing - to cover all elections and referenda
	Lot 2: Registration Printing - covering all printing for registration purposes
	Lot 3: Both of Lots 1 & 2 in a single integrated contract.

Organisation Name: Cheshire west and Chester Borough Council
Title: Ballot papers, Postal voting packs and Poll cards for elections
Description:
BALLOT PAPERS, POSTAL VOTING PACKS AND POLL CARDS FOR ELECTIONS.   Cheshire West and Chester Council intend to establish an agreement for 3 years with an option to extend for up to 24 months for the election printing materials as follows-

•	Ballot papers and Corresponding Numbers Lists
•	Postal vote ballot packs
•	Poll cards 
•	Postal poll cards
•	Empty property poll cards
•	Large print ballot papers

The supplier should be able to undertake all work involved in meeting the Council's election requirements for production of the above documents and meet all current and any future electoral rules. This will include but is not exclusive to providing a full print and design service delivering poll cards, ballot papers and postal vote packs. It will also include any election specific voter facing information products that may be introduced in legislation during the time of the contract.

The process must be secure and provide a quality assured process to ensure supply of accurate election materials at dates/times agreed with the Council that meet legislative requirementsand Electoral Commission guidance and directions specified by the Returning Officer. 
 Please contact The Chest, www.the-chest.org.uk  for the tender documents.

Organisation Name: Big Lottery Fund, operating as The National Lottery Community Fund
Title: BIG001-1005 Provision of Voting Adjudication Services for the People's Project
Description:
The Big Lottery Fund ("the Fund") is seeking to recruit an experienced independent voting adjudicator to deliver the requirements as set out in the Invitation to Tender for The People's Projects, a partnership programme delivered with ITV (STV in Scotland) and The National Lottery (Camelot). The scope of the Services includes the provision of a Freephone voting information Service.  

The Fund will manage the contract, but bidders must note that Camelot will be making payment for an element of the Services direct to the appointed Service Provider, and (accordingly) the appointed Service Provider will be required to invoice Camelot for the Services directly. Further details on this requirement/ provision are set out in the tender document.

Title: ESPH TI Election Printing Services (ESPH230) - AWARD
Description:
Wealden District Council as the lead Council along with the partnership Councils - Eastbourne Borough, Hastings Borough Lewes District Rother District & Brighton & Hove City Council are seeking to award a 6 year contract with an optional (up to ) 24 month extension for the provision of election printing comprising the following:
      
      A) Organise and manage the printing and issue of postal cards, postal poll cards, proxy poll cards and anonymous poll cards.
      
      B) Organise and manage the printing and issue of postal ballot packs (including overseas postage) and the printing of ballot papers for use in the polling stations (ordinary and tendered papers). 
      
      The Councils wish to work in partnership with the successful contractor with each council entering into a separate contract.

Title: Annual Billing for Council Tax and National Non Domestic Rates, and Electoral Registration Print Services
Description: The Authority invited Tenders from suitably qualified providers ("Tenderers") for the provision of Annual Billing for Council Tax and Non-Domestic Rates 2017/18, and also for the provision of Electoral Registration Printing. This was tendered under two separate lots: Lot 1 - Annual Billing for Council Tax and Non-Domestic Rates; and Lot 2 - Electoral Registration Printing Tenderers could bid for one or both lots and that each Lot could be awarded to the same supplier or different suppliers depending on what was the most economically advantageous tender option. To run from 1st November 2016 for a period of 2 years with the option to extend for a further period of up to 1 year at the sole discretion of the Authority. Lot 1 - For the supply of services for the provision of printing and mailing of Annual Billing for Council Tax, National-Non Domestic Rates bills, Housing Benefit notifications, together with printing, merging and mailing of Local Council Tax Support Notifications Lot 2 - Electoral Registration Printing includes Household Enquiry Forms, Invitation to Register Forms, Ballot Papers, Poll Cards and various ad-hoc letters
Contact Address 1: Isle of Wight Council, County Hall, High Street

Title: Provision of Electoral Services Stationery, Printing and Registration Services
Description: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham (acting as the Lead Council) on the behalf of any local authority listed in the London Government Directory (http://directory.londoncouncils.gov.uk/) is inviting tenders for the provision of stationery, printing and registration services in respect of elections and the European Referendum over the next 4 years from June 2016.It is envisaged that the Council will set up a Framework Agreement, with up to 3 Framework Contractors consisting of the following 3 Lot(s):Lot 1 Elections Stationery and Printing Services;Lot 2 Individual Electoral Registration Stationery and Printing Services;Lot 3 Telephone and Internet Electoral Registration Services.Suppliers may apply for 1 or more Lots.The Lead Council and Participating Bodies require a rapid and cost effective provision of services to meet strict deadlines and accord with legislation for the production of the annual Register of Electors and ongoing IER.

Title: PP17131 - Elections Printing
Description: Wolverhampton City Council are tendering for the provision of electoral printing and associated services including personalisation and direct mailing needs for 3years (option to extend a further year). The start date will be December 2017. This is a specialist market with the specification of presentation being laid down in law, consequently evidence, including 2 references, must be provided by the tenderer, of experience in carrying out this exact type of work. The figures for Wolverhampton City Council are included for the supply of electoral printing and associated services. We reserve the right to source our own postage costs. This tender encompasses all local, national, European and any other government elections or referenda within the timeframe of the contract and the remit of the Elections team. The intention is to award to a single supplier for each Lot, This contract will be split into two Lots as follows: Lot 1 For Local Elections, Parliamentary Elections, European Parliamentary elections and other Referenda - ballot papers and postal vote packs Lot 2 Poll cards (optional for all elections) Tenderers must be able to bid for a complete lot to be considered. Tenderers can bid for one or more Lots.

Title: Framework for Printing and Mailing for Electoral Services
Description: The Authority is looking to procure: - The printing of voter registration forms, information leaflets and envelopes for the purpose of the annual canvass and ongoing registration. - The printing of poll cards and absent vote poll cards for the purpose of elections and referenda. - The printing of ballot papers for elections, by-elections and referenda. - The printing of Postal Voting Packs (including outer envelope, Envelope A, Envelope B, Postal Vote Statement,instructions sheet) for elections and referenda. One Piece Mailer method is required. - Postal Vote Refresh Letters and Reminders. This includes the enclosing, sealing and posting as required bycontracting authorities. - Associated mail house functions including extracting, enclosing, sealing and posting. The scope of services may change in accordance with legislation.
Additional Text: A consortium, including Corby Borough Council wishes to invite Tenders for the supply of goods and services in respect of framework for printing and mailing for electoral services.

Organisation Name: Big Lottery Fund, operating as The National Lottery Community Fund
Title: NAT001-0301 Social Media Voting for the National Lottery Awards 25th Birthday
Description:
The National Lottery Promotions Unit requires a digital service provider to create and
manage a social media voting solution for the 2019 National Lottery Awards. The
social media voting will primarily take place on Twitter and employ trackable and
verifiable voting hashtags or a suitable alternative voting mechanism. Within budget
the unit would also like to explore voting on other social media platforms such as
Facebook or Instagram.
The appointed agency will be responsible for Monitoring and counting social media
for votes, creating daily reports throughout the voting period with tallies for each
individual project that are adjudicated by the Electoral Reform Service.
Ensuring voting is within the Electoral reform services rules and guidance, this
includes a vetting process for votes so that only one vote is counted from each
account in their respective categories.
Responding within an hour for urgent enquiries and within a day for non-urgent
enquiries regarding this system.
Providing a live dashboard for the NLPU to be able to see the social media voting
figures
To be compatible with GDPR legislation regarding the secure transfer of Data.
It is expected there will be around 50 finalists competing in 5 categories. However, is
subject to official confirmation.
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Scotland,Wales,Northern Ireland
